Viacom has collaborated with several external organizations and partners to increase diversity and inclusion efforts. Some of these collaborations include:

1. National Urban League: Viacom partnered with the National Urban League to expand its pipeline of diverse candidates for internships and entry-level positions. The partnership also focuses on creating a more inclusive work environment through employee training and development programs.

2. The Association of National Advertisers (ANA): Viacom is a member of the ANA's Alliance for Inclusive and Multicultural Marketing (AIMM), which aims to promote diversity and inclusion in marketing and advertising.

3. Trevor Project: Viacom partnered with The Trevor Project, a non-profit organization that provides crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to LGBTQ+ youth. The partnership involves creating content that promotes acceptance and support for LGBTQ+ individuals.

4. The Ad Council: Viacom partnered with The Ad Council to launch the "Love Has No Labels" campaign, which aims to promote inclusivity and reject bias.

5. National Hispanic Foundation for the Arts: Viacom partnered with the National Hispanic Foundation for the Arts to create an internship program for Hispanic students interested in pursuing careers in media and entertainment.

Overall, Viacom's partnerships and collaborations with external organizations and partners demonstrate its commitment to diversity and inclusion in the workplace and in society as a whole.
